intro: Otostegia limbata, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Otostegia limbata is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
